blocks.name: mpt2ndm0
blocks.content: The value of an operation given by a maps-to rule is the empty set if the arguments are not contained in the base sets of the rule. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 12-Oct-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm mpt2ndm0(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wn(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))), wceq(co(c0, c4, c2), emptycls))
  -| wceq(c4, cmpo(s0, s1, c1, c3, c5))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  mpan(wn(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))), wceq(co(c0, c4, c2), emptycls), wss(cdm(c4), cxp(c1, c3)))
  eqsstri(cdm(c4), cxp(c1, c3), cdm(coprab(s0, s1, hs0, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c3)), wceq(cv(hs0), c5)))))
  dmeqi(c4, coprab(s0, s1, hs0, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c3)), wceq(cv(hs0), c5))))
  eqtri(c4, coprab(s0, s1, hs0, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c3)), wceq(cv(hs0), c5))), cmpo(s0, s1, c1, c3, c5))
  df-mpo(s0, s1, hs0, c1, c3, c5)
  dmoprabss(s0, s1, hs0, c1, c3, wceq(cv(hs0), c5))
  nssdmovg(c4, c1, c3, c0, c2)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
}

  df-mpo(s0, s1, hs0, c4, c5, c6)
  dmoprabss(s0, s1, hs0, c4, c5, wceq(cv(hs0), c6))
  eleq2s(c0, co(c1, c2, c3), cfv(c2, cop(c1, c3)), wcel(cop(c1, c3), cdm(c2)))
  elfvdm(c0, c2, cop(c1, c3))
  df-ov(c1, c2, c3)
  opelxp(c1, c3, c4, c5)

blocks.name: elmpt2cl1
blocks.content: If a two-parameter class is not empty, the first argument is in its nominal domain. (Contributed by FL, 15-Oct-2012.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: elmpt2cl2
blocks.content: If a two-parameter class is not empty, the second argument is in its nominal domain. (Contributed by FL, 15-Oct-2012.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: 2mpt20
blocks.content: If the operation value of the operation value of two nested maps-to notation is not empty, all involved arguments belong to the corresponding base classes of the maps-to notations. (Contributed by AV, 21-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2mpt20(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10) {
  |- wi(wn(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, c5), wcel(c6, c7)))), wceq(co(c4, co(c0, c8, c2), c6), emptycls))
  -| wceq(c8, cmpo(s0, s1, c1, c3, c9))
  -| wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(co(c0, c8, c2), cmpo(s2, s3, c5, c7, c10)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c5)
  -| diffsc(s2, c7)
  -| diffsc(s3, c5)
  -| diffsc(s3, c7)
} = {
  sylbi(wn(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, c5), wcel(c6, c7)))), wceq(co(c4, co(c0, c8, c2), c6), emptycls), wo(wn(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))), wn(wa(wcel(c4, c5), wcel(c6, c7)))))

  jaoi3(wn(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))), wn(wa(wcel(c4, c5), wcel(c6, c7))), wceq(co(c4, co(c0, c8, c2), c6), emptycls))

  âŠ£ d(s0, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c4)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c3)
  âŠ£ d(s0, w0)
  âŠ£ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  f1ocnvd(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c2, c1, w0)
  impbida(w0, (s1 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ s0 = c4), (s0 âˆˆ c2 âˆ§ s1 = c3))
  jcai((w0 âˆ§(s1 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ s0 = c4)), s0 âˆˆ c2, s1 = c3)
  impr(w0, s1 âˆˆ c1, s0 = c4, s0 âˆˆ c2)
  syl((w0 âˆ§ s1 âˆˆ c1), (s0 = c4 â†’ s0 âˆˆ c2), c4 âˆˆ c2)
  eleq1a(c4, c2, s0)
  imp32(w0, s1 âˆˆ c1, s0 = c4, (s0 âˆˆ c2 â†’ s1 = c3))
  com34(w0, s1 âˆˆ c1, s0 = c4, s0 âˆˆ c2, s1 = c3)
  exp42(w0, s1 âˆˆ c1, s0 âˆˆ c2, s0 = c4, s1 = c3)
  biimpar((w0 âˆ§(s1 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ s0 âˆˆ c2)), s0 = c4, s1 = c3)
  jcai((w0 âˆ§(s0 âˆˆ c2 âˆ§ s1 = c3)), s1 âˆˆ c1, s0 = c4)
  impr(w0, s0 âˆˆ c2, s1 = c3, s1 âˆˆ c1)
  syl((w0 âˆ§ s0 âˆˆ c2), (s1 = c3 â†’ s1 âˆˆ c1), c3 âˆˆ c1)
  eleq1a(c3, c1, s1)
  imp32(w0, s0 âˆˆ c2, s1 = c3, (s1 âˆˆ c1 â†’ s0 = c4))
  com34(w0, s0 âˆˆ c2, s1 = c3, s1 âˆˆ c1, s0 = c4)
  com23(w0, s0 âˆˆ c2, s1 âˆˆ c1, (s1 = c3 â†’ s0 = c4))
  exp42(w0, s1 âˆˆ c1, s0 âˆˆ c2, s1 = c3, s0 = c4)
  biimpa((w0 âˆ§(s1 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ s0 âˆˆ c2)), s1 = c3, s0 = c4)
}

blocks.name: f1o2d
blocks.content: Describe an implicit one-to-one onto function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm f1o2d(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf1o(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c1, c3))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c3, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c2)), wcel(c4, c1))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c2))), wb(wceq(cv(s0), c4), wceq(cv(s1), c3)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  simpld(w0, wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccnv(c0), cmpt(s1, c2, c4)))
  f1ocnv2d(s1, s0, c0, c1, c2, c4, c3, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm f1o2d(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  âŠ¢ (w0 â†’(c0 : c1 â†” c2))
  âŠ£ c0 =(s0 âˆˆ c1 â†¦ c3)
  âŠ£ ((w0 âˆ§ s0 âˆˆ c1)â†’ c3 âˆˆ c2)
  âŠ£ ((w0 âˆ§ s1 âˆˆ c2)â†’ c4 âˆˆ c1)
  âŠ£ ((w0 âˆ§(s0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ s1 âˆˆ c2))â†’(s0 = c4 â†” s1 = c3))
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c4)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c3)
  âŠ£ d(s0, w0)
  âŠ£ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  simpld(w0, (c0 : c1 â†” c2), `' c0 =(s1 âˆˆ c2 â†¦ c4))
  f1ocnv2d(s1, s0, c0, c1, c2, c4, c3, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: f1opw2
blocks.content: A one-to-one mapping induces a one-to-one mapping on power sets. This version of ~ f1opw avoids the Axiom of Replacement. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)

thm f1opw2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf1o(cmpt(s0, cpw(c0), cima(c1, cv(s0))), cpw(c0), cpw(c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wf1o(c1, c0, c2))

  -| diffsc(s1, c1)

  syl5ibrcom(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpw(c2)))), wceq(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c1), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), cima(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s1), cima(c1, cima(ccnv(c1), cv(s1)))))
  eqcomd(cv(s1), cima(c1, cima(ccnv(c1), cv(s1))), wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpw(c2)))))
  syl2an(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpw(c2))), wceq(cima(c1, cima(ccnv(c1), cv(s1))), cv(s1)), wfo(c1, c0, c2), wss(cv(s1), c2))
  syl(w0, wfo(c1, c0, c2), wf1o(c1, c0, c2))
  f1ofo(c1, c0, c2)
  adantl(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpw(c2)), wss(cv(s1), c2))
  elpwi(cv(s1), c2)
  foimacnv(c1, c0, c2, cv(s1))
  eqeq2d(cv(s1), cima(c1, cv(s0)), cima(c1, cima(ccnv(c1), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c1), cv(s1))))
  imaeq2(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c1), cv(s1)), c1)
  syl5ibrcom(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpw(c2)))), wceq(cv(s1), cima(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c1), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c1), cima(c1, cv(s0)))))
  eqcomd(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c1), cima(c1, cv(s0))), wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpw(c2)))))
  syl2an(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpw(c2))), wceq(cima(ccnv(c1), cima(c1, cv(s0))), cv(s0)), wf1(c1, c0, c2), wss(cv(s0), c0))
  syl(w0, wf1(c1, c0, c2), wf1o(c1, c0, c2))
  f1of1(c1, c0, c2)
  adantr(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpw(c2)), wss(cv(s0), c0))
  elpwi(cv(s0), c0)
  f1imacnv(c1, c0, c2, cv(s0))
  eqeq2d(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c1), cv(s1)), cima(ccnv(c1), cima(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s1), cima(c1, cv(s0))))
  imaeq2(cv(s1), cima(c1, cv(s0)), ccnv(c1))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c0)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c2)
  diff.cima.s(s0, ccnv(c1), cv(s1))
  diff.ccnv.s(s0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cpw.s(s1, c0)
  diff.cpw.s(s1, c2)
  diff.cima.s(s1, c1, cv(s0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

  syl(w0, (c1 : c0 â†  c2), (c1 : c0 â†” c2))

  eqcomd(s0, (`' c1 "(c1 " s0)), (w0 âˆ§(s0 âˆˆ P(c0)âˆ§ s1 âˆˆ P(c2))))

blocks.name: f1opw
blocks.content: A one-to-one mapping induces a one-to-one mapping on power sets. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 18-Nov-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm f1opw(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wf1o(cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cima(c0, cv(s0))), cpw(c1), cpw(c2)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  f1opw2(s0, hs0, c1, c0, c2, wf1o(c0, c1, c2))
  id(wf1o(c0, c1, c2))
  simplbiim(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wcel(cima(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0)), universe), wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfun(ccnv(c0)))
  dff1o3(c0, c1, c2)
  funimaex(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0))
  vex(hs0)
  syl(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe), wfun(c0))
  f1ofun(c0, c1, c2)
  funimaex(c0, cv(s0))
  vex(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.wf1o.s(s0, c0, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wf1o(c0, c1, c2))
}

blocks.name: elovmpt3imp
blocks.content: If the value of a function which is the result of an operation defined by the maps-to notation is not empty, the operands must be sets. Remark: a function which is the result of an operation can be regared as operation with 3 operands - therefore the abbreviation "mpt3" is used in the label. (Contributed by AV, 16-May-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm elovmpt3imp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(co(c1, c2, c3), c4)), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe)))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, cmpt(s2, c5, c6)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(co(c1, c2, c3), c4)), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe)), wne(cfv(co(c1, c2, c3), c4), emptycls))
  ne0i(c0, cfv(co(c1, c2, c3), c4))
  pm2.61i(wi(wne(cfv(co(c1, c2, c3), c4), emptycls), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe))), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe)))
  ax-1(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe)), wne(cfv(co(c1, c2, c3), c4), emptycls))
  3syl(wn(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe))), wi(wne(cfv(co(c1, c2, c3), c4), emptycls), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe))), wceq(co(c1, c2, c3), emptycls), wceq(cfv(co(c1, c2, c3), c4), emptycls))
  mpt2ndm0(s0, s1, c1, universe, c3, universe, c2, cmpt(s2, c5, c6))
  syl6eq(cfv(co(c1, c2, c3), c4), emptycls, cfv(emptycls, c4), wceq(co(c1, c2, c3), emptycls))
  fveq1(co(c1, c2, c3), emptycls, c4)
  0fv(c4)
  eqneqall(cfv(co(c1, c2, c3), c4), emptycls, wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe)))
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: elovmpt3rab1
blocks.content: Implications for the value of an operation defined by the maps-to notation with a function into a class abstraction as a result having an element. The domain of the function and the base set of the class abstraction may depend on the operands, using implicit substitution. (Contributed by AV, 16-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 16-May-2019.)
